alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 5:02PM MST until June 30 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 502 PM MST, Flash flooding is ongoing in Sonoita Creek. Expect water to continue flowing down the creek toward Patagonia Lake. The warning has been extended by 1 hour. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Patagonia. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sonoita Creek and Harshaw Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
